The file should either be read witha  default encoding or skipped.
IMO, skipping would be better. Resources with unknown encoding should better 
be excluded from the model and operations working on the model.

Dani, is there an existing policy here?

The bug is not critical for 3.0.1 since search does not stop: it collects all
errors (as multi-status) and reports them at the end. The bug is that this gets
written to .log: it should only be presented in the UI. In addition the error
message could be more user-friendly, e.g.:
"File x could not be searched because its encoding (y) could is not supported".
